intro: Pimelea nitens subsp. aspera, commonly known as the rough pimelea, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It features small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. The plant has rough, hairy leaves that are usually narrow and linear in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and rocky areas. The subspecies is distinguished by its more rugged leaf texture compared to other forms of Pimelea nitens.
